reviews.text: I've stayed here on many occasions now. The Houstonian has a comfortable colonial feel to it which means that a business trip quickly becomes a more pleasurable experience. The rooms can feel a little dark because of the tall trees outside, but are comfortable and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Top Class!

reviews.text: Staff are attentive and the bar and restaurant are top quality.
reviews.title: Wow, what a great place for $200!

reviews.text: The best part is the multi-pool spa on site, which in the warm weather quickly eases theaches and stresses of the road to get to The Houstonian
reviews.title: "Elegant"

reviews.text: Love this hotel/resort. It really is much more than a hotel. Sadly I was only here for one night, it would be great for a few days to try out all the amenities. The decor is classic, lots of hardwood. It reminds me of a lodge because it has a huge central fireplace in the lobby. Rooms are great, very comfortable. I didn't get to try the pool, but the pictures look pretty awesome. Great stay for the money. Oh, the steak sandwich on the restaurant is pretty great too!
reviews.title: Lovely setting in Houston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a beautiful hotel with old world charm, quite and peaceful hidden away from all the Houston traffic. We were greeted with friendly, fast and efficient staff upon check in while visiting for a wedding reception at the hotel ballroom this weekend. We had so many out of town family members at this hotel and everyone loved it, beds were comfortable and cozy. The only issues we had was the view outside our window were vines and trees and the small bathroom. Although this hotel is hard to find, we used a navigating system to find it, this will be a definite hotel to return to every time we are in Houston.
reviews.title: Relaxing

reviews.text: I stayed in the Houstonian during my business trip for a week. It's a great hotel, I'd call it "Old Houston" with an amazing property, friendly crew and clean rooms. The territory of the hotel is very green and it feels like the hotel is located in the middle of a big garden where a lot of wild squirrels, birds and rabbits live. No need to mention the fantastic sport club which belongs to the hotel with a couple swimming pools (including an Olympic size pool outside with a warm water during cold days). The Spa is great. I had a facial and was very satisfied with the job that was done with my face. The hotel is located next to Memorial park and it's walking distance to the park for those who like to exercise. The Italian restaurant located next to the hotel has fantastic food and if you like a nice cup of cappuccino served with a wonderful cookie beautify decorated with sugar-this restaurant is just right for you. No need to write much- just chose this hotel if you like yourself.
reviews.title: That's the hotel to stay in Houston

reviews.text: I stayed here in August 2013. I stayed on the club level because I have kids and didn't want to leave the property but didn't want to pay full restaurant or room service prices either. With the club level you pay a little more for the room but you get continental breakfast, cocktails, light dinner and after dinner sweets as well as liquers included. If you have kids and don't really want to leave the property but want to save some money I would recommend the club level. It also has tea, coffee and sodas all day. Forget using the hotel fridge, just go down to the club room and snag some sodas for the room, which is what I did. The pool is awesome if you have kids, it has a log slide into the pool that the kids loved. It's everything you expect of a hotel of this type.
reviews.title: What's not to like?

reviews.text: Some reviews said the place was older....I'm not sure what the refers to. I found everything excellent. There is also childcare at the gym (you have to stay on the resort property) but great if you want to go to the gym or just hang out by yourself. The staff are all professional and take care of you, anything you need. Each room has a keurig machine and on the club level there is also turn down service.
reviews.title: Perfect for conferences. Would visit again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can't recommend this place highly enough!
reviews.title: Lovely, well-run resort

reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights for a conference. Nice lobby, room was comfy, and the real plus was the attached Houstonian Health Club. While you stay here, you have the ability to use the Houstonian Health Club. The club offers a myriad of amenities, and has a total of 3 pools, a water slide, a hot tub, 8 tennis courts, a rock climbing wall, full gym, boxing ring, etc. etc. The Houstonian Health Club consistently places in the top 5 health clubs in the country.
reviews.title: Gracious staff makes a pleasant stay

reviews.text: The houstonian has fantastic staff. The restaurants are very nice. The food is excellent and the service is great. The spa is overated. The services you get from the spa need to be reassessed and upgraded. The staff is great. However, I have had much better spa treatments elsewhere. The rooms are also needing some updating. For what you pay at the Houstonian I would expect more.
reviews.title: Overrated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, and as always before, the Houstonian define the meaning of elegant lodging. The staff is always accommodative and attentive. Every small detail is seen as a major detail to the staff and they seldom miss even the smallest issues. This is an outstanding hotel for a weekend in Houston. Always a 5 star experience!
reviews.title: Memorable and Elegant

reviews.text: This hotel sets the standard of fine Texas luxury. The grounds are lush and the room decor is right out of the best decorator magazines and include pod coffeemakers. The pools are brilliant. They were doing work to complete a new outdoor deck when we visited. The onsite restaurant was spectacular for afternoon coffee and morning breakfast. Restaurant service could have been a little better, but didn't take away from our overall experience. Highly recommend staying here. Perfect location for a wedding reception.
reviews.title: Fine Texas Luxury

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for three nights and enjoyed it. The bedroom was very nice with good facilities, however the bathroom let the room down for a hotel of this standard. It was very cramped and a little dated.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - Great Leisure Facilities!

reviews.text: Breakfast was good, although expensive, especially if a cooked dish is selected from the menu. We went to the bar, which again, was expensive for what it was, especially fish and chips - stick with the burger if you are eating here.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel, amazing compoud, stellar gym!!

reviews.text: Beautiful grounds, luxurious lobby, comfortably large rooms, and a wide array of amenities. I've stayed here a few times and it has not failed me yet. The Olivette and Bar are very good with outstanding service. The pool is nice, but please note that this is a spot where many children from the club surround you. The fitness club is huge and has anything you want from free weights to fitness classes. The location is perfect right near Memorial park and within a short driving distance to numerous shops and restaurants. Still have yet to experience the spa.
reviews.title: Superior Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is hidden in the trees near posh River Oaks. The staff was very efficient and friendly in all areas, and the lobby is absolutely stunning. We were there in August, it I'm sure it's really special at Christmas time with the large fire place in the lobby and all of the comfy chairs and sofas. Our room was large and comfortable with a garden view. The bathroom was large and well-appointed, and there were robes, coffee and a large desk for my husband to use. The wi-fi was sketchy at times, but I realize not everyone cares about that. I made use of the fitness center that is part of a private club. It was one of the largest fitness centers I've ever been in; the amount of equipment was over the top. Our dinner in Olivette was outstanding, and the service was attentive but not hovering. There are two or three pools that we did not make use of but we saw how nice they were. There is a shuttle that leaves every hour and a half for the Galleria or other locations within a three-mile radius.
reviews.title: Classy and comfortable
Always Outstanding
reviews.text: We love staying here... It is always wonderful. We stayed on the concierge floor which is a super value. Although the hotel is relatively old it is well maintained. It is set in the trees away from the hustle and bustle of the city!

Stayed for a week here during a large high tech trade show. Hotel was quiet and away from the 15,000 other trade show attendees - so very much appreciated the calm and quiet. Hotel serve was very, very good. Room was comfortable, clean and quiet. Lobby is impressive and large, too. Hotel is not new in terms of construction but seemingly well maintained. The pool and gym is huge - I did not use them but did inspect them. Overall if I need a quiet place in HOU I would stay again. If you are looking for a modern, edgy property this is not the place.
reviews.title: A Calm Port in a Trade Show Storm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is old Houston at its finest with lush landscape done in proper souther style, the rooms are very quiet and look of the forest and bayou. Food is great and of course there is a whole life center right there.
reviews.title: Great hotel for getting away from the world
